results.title: What share of US e-commerce spending goes to Amazon?
results.content: Amazon captures **37.6% of all U.S. retail e-commerce spending** as of 2024, according to the latest verified market data from Forbes Advisor and Analyzify. With total U.S. e-commerce sales reaching $1.19 trillion in 2024, Amazon’s share represents approximately $447.4 billion in online retail revenue. * **37.6%** — Amazon’s verified share of U.S. e-commerce spending in 2024. Amazon’s U.S. Market Share. ### Amazon’s U.S. E-commerce Market Share Trend (2020-2024). | Year | Amazon Share | Total U.S. E-commerce | Amazon Revenue (Est.) |. ### Top 10 U.S. e-commerce retailers by market share. ### Top 10 U.S. E-commerce Retailers by Market Share (2024). Amazon’s market share is nearly 6× larger than its closest competitor, Walmart, demonstrating the company’s dominant position in U.S. e-commerce. Industry analysts expect Amazon’s U.S. e-commerce market share to remain relatively stable, with modest growth potential in specific categories rather than dramatic overall gains. * Forbes Advisor — E-commerce statistics and Amazon market share data (37.6% figure).

results.title: Amazon Tops 30% Market Share for Electronics - PYMNTS.com
results.content: Amazon captured 30% of the total sales in the electronics and appliances sector. This dominance in the electronics market shows Amazon's appeal to consumers.
